entry.et: Middle English bolle, from Old English bolla; akin to Old High German bolla blister

def.dt: :a concave usually nearly hemispherical vessel
:a drinking vessel (as for wine)
:the contents of a bowl
:a bowl-shaped or concave part: as
:the hollow of a spoon or tobacco pipe
:the receptacle of a toilet
:a natural formation or geographical region shaped like a bowl
:a bowl-shaped structure
:an athletic stadium
:a postseason football game between specially invited teams

entry.et: Middle English boule, from Middle French, from Latin bulla bubble

def.dt: :a ball (as of lignum vitae) weighted or shaped to give it a bias when rolled in lawn bowling
:lawn bowling
:a delivery of the ball in bowling
:a cylindrical roller or drum (as for a machine)
:to participate in a game of bowling
:to roll a ball in bowling
:to travel smoothly and rapidly (as in a wheeled vehicle)
:to roll (a ball) in bowling
:to complete by bowling bowl a string
:to score by bowling bowls 150
:to strike with a swiftly moving object
:to take unawares
:impress 2
:a region that suffers from prolonged droughts and dust storms
:a small water bowl for rinsing the fingers at the table
:a place or situation offering no privacy
:a large bowl from which a beverage (as punch) is served
:a bowl for receiving the leavings of tea or coffee cups at table
:a bowl that is used for the serving of wassail
:wassail 2
